Package ohos.agp.components

Class Text

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.components.Component
      • ohos.agp.components.Text
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Button, Clock, TabList.Tab, TextField, TickTimer

    public class Text
extends Component
    Displays text in a component.

    Text is a basic UI element.

    Since:
    3

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Text.ConversionType
      Enumerates the conversion types.

      Listens for change events of an editor action.

      Enumerates the font family types.
      static interface  Text.TextColorObserver
      Provides an observer to listen for text color changes in a component.

      Provides a text observer to observe text changes in a component.
      static interface  Text.TextSizeObserver
      Provides an observer to listen for text size changes in a component.
      static class  Text.TextSizeType
      Enumerates types of the text size.
      static class  Text.TruncationMode
      Indicates how to truncate text.

      • setTruncationMode

        public void setTruncationMode​(Text.TruncationMode mode)
        Sets the truncation mode when text content is longer than the component's width.

        When a text component cannot show all of the text content in a single line, the following modes can be selected: (1) the start, middle, or end of the text is truncated and the truncated part is displayed as an ellipsis, (2) the text will be scrolling to display the complete content or (3) truncate directly without any special processing.

        Parameters:
        mode - Indicates the truncation mode.
        See Also:
        Text.TruncationMode

        Returns:
        Returns the truncation mode; returns TruncationMode#NONE if no mode set.

      • setAutoFontSizeRule

        public void setAutoFontSizeRule​(int minFontSize,
                                int maxFontSize,
                                int autoFontStep)
        Sets the range and step of the auto font size.

        The minimum font size must be smaller than the maximum font size, and the font size step must be greater than 0.

        Parameters:
        minFontSize - Indicates the minimum auto font size.
        maxFontSize - Indicates the maximum auto font size.
        autoFontStep - Indicates the auto font size step.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws the exception if the min or max font size values less than 0 or step less than 0.
        See Also:
        setAutoFontSize(boolean)

      • setAutoScrollingDuration

        public void setAutoScrollingDuration​(long duration)
        Sets the auto scrolling duration for a long text.

        You must use this method on a text before enabling auto scrolling. The auto scrolling duration must be greater than or equal to 0, in milliseconds. If duration is set to 0, the default scrolling speed is used.

        Parameters:
        duration - Indicates the auto scrolling duration of the text component.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws the exception if the parameter value is less than 0.

      • getAutoScrollingDuration

        public long getAutoScrollingDuration​()
        Obtains the auto scrolling duration of a text.
        Returns:
        Returns the auto scrolling duration set for this text if available; returns 0 otherwise.
        See Also:
        setAutoScrollingDuration(long)

      • setAutoScrollingCount

        public void setAutoScrollingCount​(int count)
        Sets the auto scrolling count of a text.

        You must use this method on a text before enabling auto scrolling.

        Parameters:
        count - Indicates the auto scrolling count of the text, which must be greater than or equal to 1, orAUTO_SCROLLING_FOREVER, which indicates that the text component will always be in auto scrolling state.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws the exception if the parameter value is invalid.

      • setAroundElements

        public void setAroundElements​(Element left,
                              Element top,
                              Element right,
                              Element bottom)
        Sets element objects around a text.

        This method places element objects to the left, on the top, to the right, and at the bottom of a text. The sides of the element objects are determined by how the text is read.

        Note: if element's bounds didn't set then this method set it by optimal sizes.

        Parameters:
        left - Indicates the element object to the left of the text.
        top - Indicates the element object on the top the text.
        right - Indicates the element object to the right of the text.
        bottom - Indicates the element object at the bottom of the text.

      • getAroundElements

        public Element[] getAroundElements​()
        Obtains element objects around a text.

        The element objects to the left, on the top, to the right, and at the bottom of the text are returned in sequence.

        Returns:
        Returns the element object around the text.
        See Also:
        setAroundElements(Element, Element, Element, Element)

      • setAroundElementsRelative

        public void setAroundElementsRelative​(Element start,
                                      Element top,
                                      Element end,
                                      Element bottom)
        Sets element objects around a text.

        Note: if element's bounds didn't set then this method set it by optimal sizes.

        Parameters:
        start - Indicates the element object at the start of the text, which is to the left of the text if the text starts from the left, or vice versa.
        top - Indicates the element object on the top the text.
        end - Indicates the element object in the end of the text, which is to the left of the text if the text starts from the right, or vice versa.
        bottom - Indicates the element object at the bottom of the text.

      • getAroundElementsRelative

        Parameters:

      • insert

        public void insert​(String text,
                   int pos)
        Insert text in a specified position. If pos is AUTO_CURSOR_POSITION, the text is inserted in the position where the cursor is located.
        Parameters:
        text - Indicates the text to insert.
        pos - Indicates the position where to insert the text. The value AUTO_CURSOR_POSITION indicates to insert the text from the position where the cursor is located.
        Since:
        2

      • delete

        public void delete​(int length)
        Deletes text before the cursor.
        Parameters:
        length - Indicates the length of the text to delete.
        Since:
        2

      • delete

        public void delete​(int length,
                   boolean back)
        Deletes text before or after the cursor.
        Parameters:
        length - Indicates the length of the text to delete.
        back - Indicates whether to delete the text in the backward manner. true indicates to delete the text before the cursor; false indicates to delete the text after the cursor.
        Since:
        2

      • delete

        public void delete​(int length,
                   boolean back,
                   int pos)
        Deletes text from a specified position.
        Parameters:
        length - Indicates the length of the text to delete.
        back - Indicates whether to delete the text in the backward manner. true indicates to delete the text before the specified position; false indicates to delete the text after the specified position.
        pos - Indicates the position where to delete the text. The value AUTO_CURSOR_POSITION indicates to delete the text from the position where the cursor is located.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws the exception if the parameter value is less than 0.
        Since:
        2

      • setAutoFontSize

        public void setAutoFontSize​(boolean autoFontSize)
        Sets whether the text size is automatically adjusted to fill within the component.
        Parameters:
        autoFontSize - Indicates whether the text size is automatically adjusted to fill within the component. true indicates the text size is automatically adjusted to fill within the component; false indicates the text size is not automatically adjusted to fill within the component.
        See Also:
        isAutoFontSize()

      • setAutoFontSize

        public void setAutoFontSize​(boolean autoFontSize,
                            boolean userSizeFirst)
        Sets whether to adjust font size automatically to fill within the component, and whether to try the specified font size before enabling automatic font size adaption.

        It is recommended that you enable autoFontSize before enabling userSizeFirst.

        Parameters:
        autoFontSize - Indicates whether to enable automatic font size adaption. true indicates to adjust font size automatically to fill within the component, so that the complete text content can be displayed; false indicates the opposite.
        userSizeFirst - userSizeFirst Indicates whether to try the specified font size before enabling automatic font size adaption. true indicates that the specified font size is tried for the layout. If the specified font size does not allow all the text content to be displayed in the component, a suitable font size set by setAutoFontSizeRule(int,int,int) will be selected. false indicates that a suitable font size set by setAutoFontSizeRule(int,int ,int) will be used for the layout directly, without trying the specified one.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        setAutoFontSize(boolean)

      • setLineSpacing

        public void setLineSpacing​(float add,
                           float mult)
        Sets the line spacing for a text component.

        Each line has its height multiplied by mult, with add added to it. For example, when the height is 1, mult is 2, and add is 3, the line spacing is 5.

        Parameters:
        add - Indicates the value to be added to the height of each line except for the last line.
        mult - Indicates the value to be multiplied by the height of each line, except for the last line.
        See Also:
        getAdditionalLineSpacing(), getNumOfFontHeight()

      • getNumOfFontHeight

        public float getNumOfFontHeight​()
        Obtains the line spacing multiplier, which provides extra spacing between lines in a text component.
        Returns:
        Returns the line spacing multiplier.
        Since:
        4

      • getFontVariations

        public String getFontVariations​()
        Obtains the font variation settings.
        Returns:
        Returns the current font variation settings if obtained; returns an empty string if none has been specified.
        Since:
        5
        See Also:
        setFontVariations(String)

      • setFontVariations

        public boolean setFontVariations​(String variation)
        Sets the TrueType or OpenType font variation settings. The settings string consists of multiple pairs of tag and style values. The tag must contain exact four ASCII characters and must be wrapped in single quotes or double quotes. If it contains characters outside of U+0020..U+007E, it is invalid. If a specified tag name is not yet defined in the font, the settings will be ignored.

        The following shows sample code for setting the font width and weight to 100. 

         
   text.setFontVariations("'wdth' 100,'wght' 100");
        Parameters:
        variation - Indicates the font variation settings.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the passed variation is valid for the current font; returns false if the passed variation is an empty string or does not comply with the defined specifications.
        Since:
        5
        See Also:
        getFontVariations()

      • moveToPosition

        public boolean moveToPosition​(int offset)
        Moves the character to a visible position based on the specified offset.

        This method is used to scroll the text. If the text is not scrolled, false is returned.

        Parameters:
        offset - Indicates the offset of the character position. The offset value can only be a non-negative integer, any negative number is treated as 0.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the text is scrolled; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        7

        public boolean onTextEditorAction​(int actionCode)

        Parameters:

        Returns true if the event is processed; returns false otherwise.
